pageContext.claim: “House Democrats recently blocked legislation to confront the anti-Semitic movement to boycott and sanction Israel.”
pageContext.analysis: Sen. Marco Rubio’s (R-Fla.) bill to address the “Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions” (BDS) movement, which is aimed at condemning the international boycott campaign pointed toward Israel, has yet to see a vote in the House. But House Democrats have proposed an alternative bill that has gained bipartisan support, which calls BDS efforts “incompatible” with the two-state solution that has been the long held U.S. stance.
